Case Description: Patty Larceny has stolen all of Colonial Williamsburg.
Intro Video Transcript:
This is Patty Larceny, Carmen Sandiego's dimply doyenne of duplicity. Her last known whereabouts: Williamsburg, Virginia. From 1699 to 1780, Williamsburg was Virginia's capital. It was home to George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, and about 2000 others, half of whom were slaves. Williamsburg's colonial glory was restored in 1926, and today, many of the 10,000 permanent residents recreate life in the 18th century, wearing colonial era clothes and demonstrating period crafts with thousands of daily visitors. Or, they did, until today, when Patty Larceny toodled into town. She didn't just take snapshots; she took every bit of Williamsburg, and filed it in her photo album. Gumshoes, it's your job to stop:

The Williamsburglary

Presentation.Clue Description: Our first clue is just coming in through the ACME Crimenet Computer.
Presentation.Clue Text: Patty er i hovedstaden i et land nord for Tyskland, hvor hun deltager i åbningsaftenen for Verdensballetten. Kongefamilien bidrager selv til balletten og deltager i festivalen årligt.
Presentation.Translated Text: Patty is in the capital of a country north of Germany, attending opening night of the Verdensballetten ballet festival. The royal family themselves contribute to the ballet, and attend the festival annually.

Clues: Capital of a country north of Germany

Video Transcripts: Okay, gumshoes, I got the word on Patty. She's on a mountaintop line that runs from north to south. It goes through three national parks and 25 national forests in five different states. The line divides all the water in North America. The streams and rivers east of it flow toward the Atlantic Ocean. The ones to the west of it flow toward the Pacific. But Patty is only flowing in one direction: to prison.

Clues: All water east of it flows east
All water west of it flows west

Presentation.Note: I just saw Patty Larceny in my hometown. Some of Africa's most famous contemporary artists live here, such as Iyenga, Gaz Mawete, and Gims. So come to Lubumbashi and pack Patty in.

Questions.Question: Which one of these imaginary lines runs through the DRC?
You'll find more hippos in the DRC than any other place in the world. The average hippo weighs 3100 lbs. Despite their weight, how fast can a hippo run?
Choices: About twenty five miles per hour

Questions.Question: The official currency of the DRC is known as the Congolese...

Video Transcripts:
Patty: 'Oh, Carmen... This colonial lifestyle's no fun. They don't even have computer games.'
Carmen: 'Sorry, dear. ACME is closing in. Head for a Brazilian state with one of the world's longest rivers.'
Patty: 'Oh, I know the state you mean! Most of it is covered by one of the largest tropical rainforests in the world!'
Carmen: 'Right. The perfect place to hide Williamsburg. But you won't have time for computer games there, either.'
Patty: 'Oh, that's okay. I'll do my second-favourite hobby: identifying jungle insects by phylum, genus, and species.'

Clues: One of the world's largest tropical rainforests
One of the world's longest rivers

In between Ukraine and Romania, using all her sneaking skills

Round 1.Clue Description: Patty left Moldova and went back to the United States.

Clues.Clue: Patty took off for the Grand Canyon. What state is she in?
Then, she hot-footed it to the capital of New Mexico. Name it.
She carted Colonial Williamsburg across New Mexico's northern border. What state is she in now?
Next, she hoofed it to a hideout in Jackson Hole. Name the state.
Patty winged it from Wyoming to the site of the Temple Of The Sun. What state is she in now?

Video Transcripts: I just got this from ACME Junkanoonet. Junkanoo is a year-end festival that takes place every year in the capital of The Bahamas, on New Providence Island. Festival fun-seekers wear colourful crépe paper costumes like this one. And we just got word that Patty is there, shopping for a costume big enough to hide Colonial Williamsburg.
